| name            = Pleurotus australis

'''''Pleurotus australis''''', the '''brown oyster mushroom''', is a [[Agaricales|gilled]] [[fungi|fungus]] native to [[Australia]] and [[New Zealand]].  It is found on [[Wood-decay fungus|dead wood]].  Although [[Morphology (biology)|morphologically]] similar to some other ''[[Pleurotus]]'' fungi, it has been shown to be a distinct species incapable of [[Hybrid (biology)|cross-breeding]].<ref name=zerv04>{{cite journal |title=Molecular phylogeny, biogeography and speciation of the mushroom species ''Pleurotus cystidiosus'' and allied taxa| first=Georgios I. |last=Zervakis| first2=Jean-Marc |last2=Moncalvo| first3=Rytas| last3=Vilgalys| journal=Microbiology| volume=150| issue=Pt 3 | year=2004| pages=715–726| doi=10.1099/mic.0.26673-0 | pmid=14993321}}</ref><ref name=nz>{{cite journal| title=Studies in the Agaricales of New Zealand: New species, new records and renamed species of ''Pleurotus'' (Pleurotaceae)| first=BP |last=Segedin| first2=PK| last2=Buchanan| first3=JP| last3=Wilkie| journal=Australian Systematic Botany| volume=8| number=3| pages=453–482| doi=10.1071/SB9950453| year=1995}}</ref>
